record.darwin:Remarks: Specimens are the heads only. These specimens questionably may be hybrids (americanus x niger) but difficult to discern from heads only. Jaw lengths suggest americanus but overall sizes were too large for this species; presumably original collectors observed niger characters when specimens were whole. Roanoke River is a known area for hybrids and backcrosses (re Jenkins and Burkhead, 1993) - Wayne C. Starnes, 2009.
